intro: Codonoboea albina, commonly known as the white codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring lance-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms and unique foliage.
